definition: startled/to frighten/scared out of one's skin
to scare/to intimidate/to threaten/(interjection showing disapproval) tut-tut/(interjection showing astonishment)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate

sentences.english: It is " not to look not to know, look frighten jump ".
sentences.chinese: 真是“不看不知道，一看吓一跳”。

sentences.english: This is exactly what is called shocked to compare with.
sentences.chinese: 正所谓不比不知道，一比吓一跳。

sentences.english: Dog people are horrified at the very idea of choosing a moggy (cat) instead of a pooch (dog).
sentences.chinese: 而爱狗的人一听养猫这个异想天开的主意就吓一跳。

sentences.english: The first person who opens that door will get a shock.
sentences.chinese: 最先开那扇门的人会吓一跳。

sentences.english: I didn't expect it and it surprised the heck out of me.
sentences.chinese: 我都没想到这让我吓一跳。

definition: to scare/to intimidate/to threaten/(interjection showing disapproval) tut-tut/(interjection showing astonishment)
to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
unexpectedly/to one's surprise/go so far as to
to be startled/to be shocked/to be amazed
what's the matter?/what's going on?/how could that be?/how did that come about?/what's it all about?
erhua variant of 納悶|纳闷[na4 men4]
